tldr: September quarter revenue rose 8% to $102.5B and EPS reached $1.85, closing FY2025 with a record $416B in revenue. Apple guided December-quarter revenue growth of 10%-12% with gross margin of 47%-48% and an estimated $1.4B tariff cost impact.
bullets: Revenue was $102.5B (+8% YoY) and EPS was $1.85, a September quarter record.
Services hit a record $28.8B (+15%) while iPhone revenue reached $49B (+6%).
December quarter guide: revenue +10%-12%, iPhone double-digit growth, gross margin 47%-48% with ~$1.4B tariff cost impact.
themes: Enterprise iPhone cycle strengthening into holidays
China recovery remains a key enterprise swing factor

segments.title: iPhone
points: Revenue was $49B, up 6% YoY with strong demand for iPhone 17 family.
Supply constraints limited availability on several models.

segments.title: Mac and iPad
points: Mac revenue was $8.7B, up 13% YoY on MacBook Air strength.
iPad revenue was $7B, flat YoY with a difficult compare.

segments.title: Services
points: Revenue hit a record $28.8B, up 15% YoY with broad category growth.
Fiscal year services revenue surpassed $100B, up 14%.

notes.title: Tariffs
points: September quarter tariff costs were about $1.1B, in line with prior estimate.
December quarter tariff costs projected at about $1.4B under current assumptions.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Returned $24B to shareholders in Q4, including $20B in buybacks.

themes.title: iPhone demand and China
points: Management cited strong reception for iPhone 17 in China and expects return to growth.
Supply constraints limited September quarter iPhone sales.

themes.title: Services acceleration
points: Services growth was broad-based and organic, with double-digit growth across markets.
No unusual one-time impacts were cited.

top_questions.question: Why was Greater China down in Q4?
top_questions.summary: Supply constraints on iPhone models were the primary driver.

top_questions.question: What is driving December revenue acceleration?
top_questions.summary: Strong iPhone 17 demand and holiday lineup strength support 10%-12% growth.

top_questions.question: How are tariff costs evolving?
top_questions.summary: Tariff costs are expected to rise with volume, from $1.1B to $1.4B.

implications: Services growth and product mix support elevated gross margins into FY2026.
Holiday demand and iPhone 17 cycle position Apple for its strongest December quarter.
competitive_notes: China demand recovery depends on supply normalization and subsidy impact.
forecast_hooks: Track iPhone supply constraints through December quarter.
Monitor tariff cost sensitivity as volumes rise.

action_items: Validate iPhone 17 supply normalization in December.
Track services growth durability after strong Q4 acceleration.
open_questions: How quickly can China return to sustained growth?
Magnitude of AI-driven OpEx growth in FY2026.
watch_next_quarter: December quarter revenue growth versus 10%-12% guide.
Gross margin performance with higher tariff costs.
